column4: check the /var/log/maillog to see if your mail got delivered (queued)
ocean_: thanks. so mail.log shows this:Nov 14 14:40:16 monstr sendmail[23439]: nAEMdmbg023438: SYSERR(root): hash map "authinfo": unsafe map file /etc/mail/auth/client-info.db: Permission denied
it looks like i have to remake the auth.info file rather than just copy it over. does that sound possible?
you said before you copied the /etc/mail dir from your previous install. Check the permissions...
yeah, if you have sendmail-cf installed, a "make clean -C /etc/mail" && "make -C /etc/mail" might help. (re-creates the *db files)
why would mysql own authinfo.db? does this look right? -rwx------ 1 root    126    80 2009-04-29 14:43 client-info
ocean_: i did that. i use webmin to do all of that stuff because it's a GUI. I believe my dbs are up to date.
copying files from one installation to another is tricky, since the UID info on the first might not be the same on the 2nd install
have any idea who should own authinfo.db ? root?
get your permissions & ownership right. Can't you check it with your previous install? The one you copied the files from?
ocean_: it's just an fs mounted on the new system, so the permissions would show the same UID, no?
i seem to not have an old /etc/passwd.
one moment.. let me find a box w/ sendmail
ocean_, jrib: i suspect that remaking the authinfo files will fix my problem. can someone point me to a simple how-to?
no sure if this helps, but here is a freshly installed sendmail (to check your permissions/ownership etc): http://paste.ubuntu.com/318929/
the commands i send before might help in recreating your *db files: "make clean -C /etc/mail && make -C /etc/mail"
